content.text:
# List of pilots awarded an Aviator's Certificate by the Royal Aero Club in 1914

The Royal Aero Club issued Aviators Certificates from 1910. These were internationally recognised under the Fédération Aéronautique Internationale.
List
{|class="wikitable"
|-
!colspan=5 |Aviator's Certificates awarded
|-
|align="center"|in 1910(1–38)
|align="center"|in 1911(39–168)
|align="center"|in 1912(169–382)
|align="center"|in 1913(383–719)
|align="center"|in 1914(720–1032)
|}
Legend
{| class="wikitable"
|+ Royal Aero Club certificates awarded in 1914 (nos. 720–1032)
! width="5%" |No. !! width="23%" |Name !! width="13%" |Date !! width="59%" |Comment
|-
| align="center" |720
| style="background:#e3d9ff;" |Captain Robert John Lillywhite RFC
| align="center" |1 January 1914
|Died 26 November 1916 (killed in "an aeroplane accident at the Front", aged 23), nephew of the famous cricketer James Lillywhite.
|-
| align="center" |721
|Sub-Lt. Franklin Geoffrey Saunders RNVR
| align="center" |1 January 1914
| Franklin Saunders was a World War I flying ace credited with eight aerial victories.
|-

|Hugh Barnes Martindale
| align="center" |1 January 1914

| align="center" |15 January 1914

|-
